entries.content: I'll read the spec file and create an implementation plan with phases and subtasks.

entries.detail:
1â†’# Web Dashboard for API Key Management
     2â†’
     3â†’A simple, responsive web UI for creating, viewing, editing, and deleting API keys without manual JSON editing. Includes real-time usage visualization and quota monitoring.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Current manual JSON editing is error-prone and requires technical expertise. A web UI makes API key management accessible to all team members and addresses competitor pain points about complexity (Portkey, Azure APIM). Reduces operational overhead for administrators.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a system administrator, I want to create and manage API keys through a web interface so that I don't have to manually edit JSON files
    10â†’- As a team lead, I want to view real-time usage statistics for all team members so that I can monitor quota consumption
    11â†’- As a non-technical user, I want to reset my own API key through a simple UI so that I don't need to contact IT staff
    12â†’
    13â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    14â†’- [ ] Users can create new API keys through web form with validation
    15â†’- [ ] Users can view all API keys in table format with sorting/filtering
    16â†’- [ ] Users can edit existing key properties (name, quota, expiry, model)
    17â†’- [ ] Users can delete API keys with confirmation dialog
    18â†’- [ ] Real-time display of token usage and remaining quota
    19â†’- [ ] Dashboard is responsive and works on mobile devices
    20â†’- [ ] Authentication required to access dashboard (basic auth or token)
    21â†’- [ ] API key changes take effect immediately without service restart
    22â†’

1â†’{
     2â†’  "feature": "Web Dashboard for API Key Management",
     3â†’  "description": "# Web Dashboard for API Key Management

A simple, responsive web UI for creating, viewing, editing, and deleting API keys without manual JSON editing. Includes real-time usage visualization and quota monitoring.

## Rationale
Current manual JSON editing is error-prone and requires technical expertise. A web UI makes API key management accessible to all team members and addresses competitor pain points about complexity (Portkey, Azure APIM). Reduces operational overhead for administrators.

## User Stories
- As a system administrator, I want to create and manage API keys through a web interface so that I don't have to manually edit JSON files
- As a team lead, I want to view real-time usage statistics for all team members so that I can monitor quota consumption
- As a non-technical user, I want to reset my own API key through a simple UI so that I don't need to contact IT staff

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Users can create new API keys through web form with validation
- [ ] Users can view all API keys in table format with sorting/filtering
- [ ] Users can edit existing key properties (name, quota, expiry, model)
- [ ] Users can delete API keys with confirmation dialog
- [ ] Real-time display of token usage and remaining quota
- [ ] Dashboard is responsive and works on mobile devices
- [ ] Authentication required to access dashboard (basic auth or token)
- [ ] API key changes take effect immediately without service restart
",
     4â†’  "created_at": "2026-01-22T03:26:55.838Z",
     5â†’  "updated_at": "2026-01-22T03:26:58.204Z",
     6â†’  "status": "in_progress",
     7â†’  "phases": [],
     8â†’  "planStatus": "in_progress"
     9â†’}

entries.content: Now let me initialize the build-progress.txt file:

Perfect! I've successfully created a comprehensive implementation plan for the **Web Dashboard for API Key Management** feature. Here's what I've set up:

## ðŸ“‹ Implementation Plan Created

**Location:** `.auto-claude/specs/002-web-dashboard-for-api-key-management/implementation_plan.json`

### Plan Structure

**5 Phases, 23 Subtasks** with an estimated total time of **8 hours 15 minutes**

#### Phase Breakdown:

1. **Foundation and Setup** (65 min)
   - Initialize project structure and dependencies
   - Create server entry point with Bun.serve()
   - Build HTML layout
   - Set up CSS framework

2. **Backend API Implementation** (165 min)
   - API key data access layer with atomic file operations
   - RESTful endpoints (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE)
   - Usage statistics endpoint
   - WebSocket support for real-time updates

3. **Frontend UI Components** (230 min)
   - React app with TypeScript
   - Sortable/filterable API key table
   - Create/edit forms with validation
   - Usage visualization (progress bars, charts)
   - Confirmation dialogs
   - Responsive mobile design

4. **Authentication** (80 min)
   - Authentication middleware (bearer token/basic auth)
   - Login page
   - Session management
   - WebSocket security

5. **Testing and Deployment** (175 min)
   - API endpoint tests
   - WebSocket testing
   - Manual UI testing
   - Hot-reload verification
   - Documentation

### Key Features Planned

âœ… **All Acceptance Criteria Addressed:**
- Create, view, edit, delete API keys through web UI
- Real-time usage visualization and quota monitoring
- Responsive design with mobile support
- Authentication required
- Immediate effect without service restart
- Sorting and filtering capabilities

### Technical Approach

- **Runtime:** Bun (for optimal performance and built-in WebSocket)
- **Frontend:** React 18+ with TypeScript
- **Styling:** Custom CSS with responsive utilities
- **Real-time:** WebSocket for live updates
- **Data:** Atomic file operations on api_keys.json

The plan is ready for implementation. Would you like me to proceed with **Phase 1: Foundation and Setup**?
I'll help you implement this subtask. Let me first read the spec, plan, and progress files to understand the context.
